intro: Spermacoce linoides, commonly known as the lesser bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm. The plant has opposite, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a dry capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Spermacoce linoides is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
